result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramond B Llewellyn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine:  $267.50 to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per moth starting 08-01-2015, alternate 20 hours of Community Service if not paid.  Community Service to be performed within 30 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tramond B Llewellyn

defendant.name: Llewellyn, Tramond B

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50 (court waives DV surcharge) - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 8/1/15, alternate 20 hours of community service if not paid (to be performed within 30 days). Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.

Jury status hearing on July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery provided to defense.  Atty. Smith requests 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is eligible for PD appointment.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant would like to hire his own attorney and needs about 2 months.  Court will allow about 2 weeks.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and return Friday.  Hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.   Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Tramond B Llewellyn in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
